Product Summary |Offer Lipoic Acid(100.0 Mg) + Vitamin B6 / Pyridoxine(3.0 Mg) B12 / Mecobalamin Mcg) + Vitamin D3 / Cholecalciferol(1000.0 Iu)| Check more medicines with composition as Vitamin B9 / Folic Acid / Folate(1.5 Mg) + Alpha Lipoic Acid(100.0 Mg) + Vitamin B6 / Pyridoxine(3.0 Mg) B12 / Mecobalamin / Cholecalciferol(1000.0 Iu) 2 Generic Alternate(s) Contains same composition as B 29 Strip Of 10 Tablets - Myelopack Tablets View All Uses of B 29 Strip Of 10 Tablets - B 29 tablet is used as a nutritional supplement to improve general well being and overall health. - It is also used for diabetic neuropathy (a type of nerve damage that can occur with diabetes). Precautions and Warnings of B 29 Strip Of 10 Tablets Other General Warnings Talk to your doctor if - You are pregnant, planning to get pregnant or breastfeeding. Do not take this medicine without consulting your doctor. - You have any existing medical conditions of the heart, kidney, liver, prostate problems or any other diseases, consult your doctor before starting the B 29 tablet. - You have a condition called malabsorption syndrome or megaloblastic anaemia. - You have too much calcium in the blood. - You are on other medications, supplements or following any complementary or integrative health approaches. - You are allergic to any of the components of this medicine. - You are going to undergo any surgery or operation. - You should avoid consuming alcohol in an excessive amount while taking this supplement. - B 29 tablet should be taken at the exact dose and for the exact duration as prescribed by the doctor. Ingredients and Benefits of B 29 Strip Of 10 Tablets - Alpha-lipoic acid is an antioxidant it protects the body from oxidative damages. It can reduce hyperglycemia-induced cell death of nerves. It can also reduce pain, abnormal sensation and numbness associated with diabetic neuropathy.... - Methylcobalamine is a form of vitamin B12 which helps in the formation of nerve cells and regeneration of damaged nerves in the brain. It is also essential for proper red blood cell formation, neurological function and DNA synthesis. ... - Vitamin D3 plays an important role in the absorption of calcium and helps in building strong and healthy bones. It also improves neuronal function, formation of neuronal cells and can help prevent damage to neurons.... - Folic acid helps the body form healthy red blood cells. It is also involved in important physiological reactions and the synthesis of chemical messengers in the brain. It can improve nerve conduction in diabetic neuropathy.... - Pyridoxine is also known as vitamin B6 is a crucial component for various reactions and acts as a co-enzyme in the body. Directions for Use of B 29 Strip Of 10 Tablets - B 29 tablet should be taken as directed by your doctor. - Swallow it as a whole with a glass of water. Do not cut, break or chew the medicine. - It would be best if you take it at a fixed time for optimal results. - You should not consume it more than that prescribed by your doctor. Storage and disposal of B 29 Strip Of 10 Tablets - Store B 29 tablet in a cool and dry place, away from direct sunlight. - Keep it out of sight and reach of children and pets. Content Details WRITTEN BY Dr. Arpit Verma MBBS, MD (Pharmacology) REVIEWED BY (Pharmacology) Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q: What is the use of B 29 tablet? A: B 29 tablet is a nutritional supplement which is used in patients who have diabetic neuropathy. It is also used as a nutritional supplement to support general health. Q: What are the side effects of B 29 tablet? A: You may sometimes experience a few side effects like a headache, nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, gas, constipation, diarrhoea, sleepiness, etc. after taking B 29 tablet. Q: Can I take B 29 tablet during pregnancy? A: You should consult your doctor before taking B 29 tablet during pregnancy, as there is limited information available about the safety of this supplement during pregnancy. Q: What is the content present in B 29? A: The content present in B 29 are- a combination of alpha-lipoic acid, folic acid, methylcobalamin, Pyridoxine and Vitamin D3. Q: Can I take B 29 daily? A: Yes, you can take B 29 daily for a specific duration suggested by the doctor. Do not take endlessly on your own without consulting a doctor. Q: When should I take B 29 tablet? A: You can take B 29 tablet at any time of the day with or without food, as told by your doctor. But it should preferably be taken in the morning after meals. It's best to take it at a fixed time for optimal results. Q: Can I take B 29 tablet during covid? A: No, you should not take B 29 tab or any supplement or medicine to treat or prevent COVID-19, unless it has been prescribed to you by your health care provider. Q: What is the dose of B 29 tablet? A: The dose and duration of treatment with B 29 depend upon the severity of your condition and your response to the treatment. Follow the doctor's instructions regarding the duration of taking the B 29 tablet. References View All [Elmecob D tablet [Internet].
